intro: Costantina inflexa, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Costantina inflexa is often found in rocky areas and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
